disconnect.description: 与睡眠系统失去连接。重新连接?

setup.title: 睡眠系统工作吗？
setup.description: 睡眠系统上蓝色灯亮了吗？

connecttimeout.title: 连接失败
connecttimeout.description: 连接失败，请确认设备已开启，并重试。

nodevices.title: 没有找到设备
nodevices.description: 未找到匹配设备，请确认设备已开启，并重试。

nodata.title: 数据不全
nodata.description: 数据不全，无法分析，请重新收集。

forgetdevice.title: 确认清除设备？
forgetdevice.description: 如果清除设备，您需要重新设置设备。继续？

start.title: 成功开启
start.description: 已进入睡眠阶段。清醒时，保存数据并关闭。

end.title: 数据上传成功
end.description: 数据上传成功，请查看新数据。

rating.title: 请为您的睡眠质量评分

syncfail.title: Failed to get data
syncfail.description: Something went wrong while trying to get data. Please turn your hat off, and back on again, then press End Sleep again.

lastsleep.title: Last Sleep Page
lastsleep.p1: The Last Sleep page is the home page of the Sleep Shepherd app.
lastsleep.p2: Here, you'll see an overview of your last sleep using your Sleep Shepherd
lastsleep.p3: You'll see how much of your sleep was light sleep and deep sleep, and how long you spent awake.

sleeplab.title: Sleep Lab Page
sleeplab.p1: The Sleep Lab page gives a more detailed look at your last night's sleep.
sleeplab.p2: The Sleep Level chart gives your sleep level throughout the night so you can see when you were in deep and light sleep.
sleeplab.p3: The Head Orientation chart shows the amount of time your head spent facing up, left, and right.

trends.title: Trends Page
trends.p1: The Trends page shows you how you've progressed since using your Sleep Shepherd.
trends.p2: Select Daily, Weekly, or Monthly to see how your amount of total and quality sleep has changed.
trends.p3: The All Time tab displays statistics that are updated every time you use your Sleep Shepherd.

settings.title: My Hat Page
settings.p1: The My Hat page allows you to change settings on your Sleep Shepherd right from the app.
settings.p2: Connect to your hat with the Connect button, then change the volume level and volume balance (from left to right) with the sliders.
settings.p3: In case you wish to connect to a different hat (e.g. if another family member wants to connect their Sleep Shepherd), use the Forget device button.
